\\documentclass.name: \documentclass
\\documentclass.description: Specifies the overall layout of the document by selecting a document class and optional parameters

\\documentstyle.name: \documentstyle
\\documentstyle.description: Specifies the overall layout of the document by selecting a document style and optional parameters. This command is for LaTeX 2.09 and deprecated in favor of \documentclass.

\\usepackage.name: \usepackage
\\usepackage.description: Loads a LaTeX package with optional parameters

\\maketitle.name: \maketitle
\\maketitle.description: Generates the title block using information from \title, \author, \date, and \thanks

\\title.name: \title
\\title.description: Defines the document title to be typeset by \maketitle

\\author.name: \author
\\author.description: Defines the document author(s) to be typeset by \maketitle

\\date.name: \date
\\date.description: Defines the document date to be typeset by \maketitle

\\thanks.name: \thanks
\\thanks.description: Provides a footnote for the title, author, or date in the title block

\\part.name: \part
\\part.description: Starts a major sectional division at the part level; typically used in book classes; optionally adds an entry to the table of contents

\\part*.name: \part*
\\part*.description: Starts a major sectional division at the part level without adding an entry to the table of contents

\\chapter.name: \chapter
\\chapter.description: Starts a major sectional division at the chapter level; typically used in book and report classes; optionally adds an entry to the table of contents

\\chapter*.name: \chapter*
\\chapter*.description: Starts a major sectional division at the chapter level without adding an entry to the table of contents

\\section.name: \section
\\section.description: Starts a major sectional division at the section level; typically used in articles, books, and reports; optionally adds an entry to the table of contents

\\section*.name: \section*
\\section*.description: Starts a major sectional division at the section level without adding an entry to the table of contents

\\subsection.name: \subsection
\\subsection.description: Starts a sectional division at the subsection level; optionally adds an entry to the table of contents

\\subsection*.name: \subsection*
\\subsection*.description: Starts a sectional division at the subsection level without adding an entry to the table of contents

\\subsubsection.name: \subsubsection
\\subsubsection.description: Starts a sectional division at the subsubsection level; optionally adds an entry to the table of contents

\\subsubsection*.name: \subsubsection*
\\subsubsection*.description: Starts a sectional division at the subsubsection level without adding an entry to the table of contents

\\paragraph.name: \paragraph
\\paragraph.description: Starts a sectional division at the paragraph level; optionally adds an entry to the table of contents

\\paragraph*.name: \paragraph*
\\paragraph*.description: Starts a sectional division at the paragraph level without adding an entry to the table of contents

\\subparagraph.name: \subparagraph
\\subparagraph.description: Starts a sectional division at the subparagraph level; optionally adds an entry to the table of contents

\\subparagraph*.name: \subparagraph*
\\subparagraph*.description: Starts a sectional division at the subparagraph level without adding an entry to the table of contents
